DataElement.preferredName: Right Breast Primary Neoplasm Location Mammogram Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the abnormal result of a mammogram performed on the right breast.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the location of a primary tumor (abnormal mass of tissue that results from excessive cell division) in the right breast (one of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.:One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify information related to a mammogram diagnostic assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: (MAM-o-gram) An x-ray of the breast.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: A low voltage X-ray photograph of the breast generally done to detect breast cancer. This method is also valuable in diagnosis of benign abnormal conditions of the breast such as fibroadenoma, mastitis, abscess, and cysts.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

DataElement.origin: IBCSG CRF:International Breast Cancer Study Group Case Report Form
